thread.title: InventHelp Inventors Develop Improved Live Bait Well (TOR-9370)
thread.title_full: InventHelp Inventors Develop Improved Live Bait Well (TOR-9370) - CBS News 8 - San Diego, CA News Station - KFMB Channel 8

author: cbs8
title: InventHelp Inventors Develop Improved Live Bait Well (TOR-9370)
text:
InventHelp, based in Pittsburgh, Pa., is submitting the FISH HOTEL to appropriate companies for their review.
PITTSBURGH, PA (PRWEB) October 26, 2015
"A friend of mine enjoys ice fishing, and he needed a better way to store his bait fish so that they stayed alive and healthy," said one of two inventors from Oshawa, Ontario, Canada. "We designed this improved live well as a better solution for storing bait fish."
They created a prototype for the FISH HOTEL to serve as an easy-to-use live well. The unit keeps bait fish alive and healthy. This ensures that bait fish offer more effective presentations. The invention increases the chances of making a successful catch. Additionally, it makes fishing trips more productive and enjoyable.
The original design was submitted to the Toronto office of InventHelp. It is currently available for licensing or sale to manufacturers or marketers. For more information, write Dept. 14-TOR-9370, InventHelp, 217 Ninth Street, Pittsburgh, PA 15222, or call (412) 288-1300 ext. 1368. Learn more about InventHelp's Invention Submission Services at http://www.InventHelp.com - https://www.youtube.com/user/inventhelp
